Is the spec for how beans are stored in the session "published"?  If so,
where....

thanks.

Mathieu Gervais wrote:
> 
> >I'm not sure I understand what you've described.  I'm growing a
> >framework for testing JSPs by just calling them locally.  But, how do
> >you get the JSP-compiled code to use the right (mock) class?  The only
> >way I can see, is to completely avoid the <usebean> functionality, and
> >roll your own equivalent code which is "mock-aware".
> >
> 
> Why not just have your test code put the right mock object in the session
> (or request) objects? Usebean is no magic, is just does a getAttribute. I
> guess you are talking about beans that get instantiated (with parameters) by
> the JSP itself, in which case a trick would be to have your mock have the
> same classname (hello confusion!) and be put before the real objects in your
> classpath during unit testing.
> 
> mathieu
